com.wingfoot.tools
Class Options

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.tools.Options
public class Options
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates the command line options that is specified when one of the command line tools in invoked. Depending on the kind of tool, some properties in this class may be not applicable for the tool.

Constructor Detail

Options

public Options()
Method Detail

getPackageMapping

public java.util.Hashtable getPackageMapping()
Returns the packageMapping. A package mapping is used to map a namespace to a package name. This is used while generating Java stubs from WSDL. Other than WSDL2Java, this method returns null.
Returns:
Hashtable of packageMapping; the key is the namespace and the value is the package name; returns null if there is no packagemapping.

getPackageMapping

public java.lang.String getPackageMapping(java.lang.String namespace)
Returns the package name associated to the namespace. Only useful in WSDL2Java.
Parameters:
namespace - String with the namespace for which the package name is desired.
Returns:
String the package name; null is the namespace is not mapped to a package.

setPackageMapping

public void setPackageMapping(java.lang.String namespace,
                              java.lang.String packageName)
Associates a namespace to a package. Only used in WSDL2Java.
Parameters:
namespace - the namespace
packageName - to associate to the namespace.

getServiceEndPoint

public java.lang.String getServiceEndPoint()
Retrieves the endpoint of the service. This appears in the <port> element in the WSDL. This options is used in java2wsdl utility.
Returns:
String the endpoint of the service.

setServiceEndPoint

public void setServiceEndPoint(java.lang.String newEndPoint)
Sets the endpoint of the service. This appears in the <port> element in the WSDL. This option is used in java2wsdl utility.
Parameters:
newEndPoint - the endpoint of the service.

isStyleDocument

public boolean isStyleDocument()
Retrieves true if the Style is specified as Document. The default is RPC. This option is set in java2wsdl utility.
Returns:
boolean true if the style is document false if not (default).

setStyleDocument

public void setStyleDocument(boolean newIsStyleDocument)
Sets the style for the WSDL. The default is RPC. This option is set in java2wsdl utility.
Parameters:
newIsStyleDocument - true if the style is document false if not (default).

getNamespaceMapping

public java.util.Hashtable getNamespaceMapping()
Retrieves the package name to namespace mapping. Only useful in Java2WSDL.
Returns:
Hashtable the package name-namespace mapping null if there is no mapping.

setNamespaceMapping

public void setNamespaceMapping(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String value)
Maps a package name to a namespace. This option is provided in the java2wsdl utility. If there is a package name for which a namespace is not provided, a namespace is assigned.
Parameters:
name - the name of the package.
value - the namespace to associate to the package.

getOutputResourceName

public java.lang.String getOutputResourceName()
Retrieves the output resource name.
Returns:
String the output resource name; null if none is specified.

setOutputResourceName

public void setOutputResourceName(java.lang.String newOutputResourceName)
Sets the file name (absolute path) where the output has to be written. This is used in java2wsdl and wsdl2java utility.
Parameters:
newOutputResourceName - the name of the resource.

getWSDLLocation

public java.lang.String getWSDLLocation()
Gets the WSDL Location
Parameters:
String - The WSDL Location

setWSDLLocation

public void setWSDLLocation(java.lang.String WSDLLocation)
Sets the WSDL Location
Parameters:
WSDLLocation - The wsdl can either be on the local filesystem or a URL

getNamespaceMapping

public java.lang.String getNamespaceMapping(java.lang.String packageName)
Retrieves the namespace for a given package name. The retrieval rules are as follows:
  • If packageName is null the namespace is http://www.wingfoot.com/namespace
  • If the namespace was not previously set using the setNamespaceMapping method OR if the namespace was set but the package name is not mapped, then the namespace is the packageName prefixed with "http://"
  • otherwise the namespace is the one mapped in the Hashtable.

    Parameters:
